moe.wyv.Sad_Bot

Class BotInstance

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jibble.pircbot.PircBot
      • moe.wyv.Sad_Bot.BotInstance
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.jibble.pircbot.ReplyConstants

    public class BotInstance
extends org.jibble.pircbot.PircBot
    All of the infrastructure for the chatbot is contained in this class. While this may make it a God class, there isn't a whole lot to be done because PircBot is a God class. The bot parses commands and skills. The commands and skills are enabled according to a settings file located in the same directory. This file will be created if it does not exist. To add more commands or skills, create an appropriate class implementing the interface, then add it to the list in Settings. Chat skills are the unique parts of this bot. They are triggered by a regular expression that matches a pattern in the chat. Please read the source files for more information.
    Author:
    fettuccine

    • Field Detail

      • settings

        private Settings settings
        YAML settings file with same name as bot

      • commands

        private java.util.List<BotCommand> commands
        List of enabled commands

      • skills

        private java.util.List<BotSkill> skills
        List of enabled skills

      • mainChannel

        private Channel mainChannel
        The channel data for the bot's primary channel. User statistics are stored here.

      • userCache

        private java.util.List<java.lang.String> userCache
        The user cache is a cache of users that join the channel. Every five minutes, if the user didn't leave, the user is added to the current viewer list and statistics are taken. This is to allow statistics on users that don't chat (lurkers), but also keeps the size of the statistics database small.

      • ai

        private MegaDon ai
        Pseudo-artificial intelligence. Not done.

    • Method Detail

      • loadData

        private void loadData(java.lang.String botName)
        This method loads settings from a file, and then populates the bot's parameters with those values. If the file does not exist, the values are populated with default values. Then the statistics data is loaded.
        Parameters:
        botName - username of bot to use in chat

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String channel,
                 java.lang.String message)
        Prevents abuse from user trying to get bot to say '.commands', which are TwitchIRC's way of sending '/commands' to chat. I don't know what happens if you send /something but I don't think it would do anything.
        Parameters:
        channel - Target channel
        message - message to send

      • sendCommand

        public void sendCommand(java.lang.String channel,
                        java.lang.String command)
        Use to send a command to the channel. This method should not be directly called by plugins unless absolutely necessary.
        Parameters:
        channel - Target channel
        command - omit preceding '.'

      • getUserForced

        public User getUserForced(java.lang.String username)
        Retrieves the user from the channel database. Note: If the user doesn't exist, they are created. Please use hasUser(String) to check if db instead.
        Parameters:
        username - name in lowercase
        Returns:
        User if they exist, null otherwise
